instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG? This is vcore going to the CPUâ€™s integrated graphics processor for CPUs that have an integrated GPU. When this is missing on a device that has an integrated GPU and no discrete GPU, it usually means either no screen is detected, or the GPU integrated into the CPU is dead..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime or image.
threads.message: So I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has no image or chime. Iv'e checked all of the rails on the power aliases page in the schematic and found the only one that seems to be missing is <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL>. it measures 0v. Shouldn't it be 1.05V?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime or image.
threads.message: Oh I did UC this board. I think it originally had no MS light so I reballed the SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime or image.
threads.message:
It works now?
AXG voltage only appears under heavy graphics load.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime or image.
threads.message: No still no image or chime.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No chime or image.
threads.message:
Is this liquid spilled board?
Do you get now all voltages (apart of AXG)?
Do you note any level drop at VCORE aftter few seconds?
Did you try each RAM slot separately?
Known good working BIOS tested?
